summary: Thomas Howarth was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears on multiple payroll certification reports for the committee, specifically for the accounting periods of February 1977, November 1977, and December 1977. These documents list his name, social security number, and salary, confirming his employment during that time. The documents serve as administrative records of the committee's staff and their compensation.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Thomas Howarth's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the documents do not specify his role within the committee, his presence on the payroll indicates he was part of the staff supporting the investigation. The payroll documents provide a record of the committee's personnel and their associated costs.
